prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in biology would.
gpt_response:
To solve for $x$, we need to use the method of linear equations. We first need to rewrite the given system of equations in matrix form:

\[
\begin{pmatrix}
3 & 4 & -12 \\
-2 & -3 & 9
\end{pmatrix}
\begin{pmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{pmatrix}
=
\begin{pmatrix}
10 \\
-4
\end{pmatrix}
\]

Next, we can represent this system of equations as the following augmented matrix:

\[
\left[
\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 4 & -12 & 10 \\
-2 & -3 & 9 & -4
\end{array}
\right]
\]

To solve for $x$, we will use the method of Gaussian elimination to transform the augmented matrix into row-echelon form. This involves performing row operations to simplify and isolate variables. 

After performing the necessary row operations, we will obtain a row-echelon form of the matrix that will allow us to easily find the value of $x$. By solving the system of equations using Gaussian elimination, we will be able to calculate the value of $x$.
